meanings.definition: A type of microphone designed to capture sound underwater.
meanings.sent1: The scientists used hydrophones to record the sounds of whales in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophones picked up the faint sounds of fish swimming in the deep sea.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophones at the bottom of the ocean had a chat with the curious dolphins.
meanings.sent4: The hydrophones acted like secret agents, eavesdropping on the underwater conversations.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophones functioned like underwater ears, listening to the mysterious sounds of the sea.

meanings.definition: Devices used to detect and locate sound underwater.
meanings.sent1: The navy deployed hydrophones to monitor underwater activity in the bay.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophones helped the researchers pinpoint the source of the underwater noise.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous octopus played hide-and-seek with the hydrophones in the coral reef.
meanings.sent4: The hydrophones were like detectives, uncovering the hidden sounds of the deep ocean.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophones functioned as underwater radars, detecting the movements of marine creatures.
